Package io.github.ai4ci.flow.output

package io.github.ai4ci.flow.output
Writers, exporters and related types for simulation output.

Main purpose: provide a small, robust framework for describing, selecting and writing simulation export records. Types in this package are used by the io.github.ai4ci.flow execution infrastructure to serialise and persist output at well-defined stages of the simulation lifecycle.

Key types and responsibilities

  • Export - annotation used on record interfaces to declare the export stage, target filename, size hint, selector and writer class;
  • Export.Selector - functional interface used to provide a stream of exportable records from an Outbreak instance;
  • OutputWriter - base interface for writer implementations;
  • CSVWriter - concrete writer for comma separated value files;
  • DuckDBWriter - concrete writer for DuckDB database files used for larger per‑agent exports;
  • QueueWriter - asynchronous buffered writer to decouple writers from the simulation thread;
  • SimulationExporter - coordinates discovery of annotated record types and invokes selectors and writers at the configured export stages.

Usage and integration

Record interfaces are annotated with Export to declare their target writer and export stage. The Export.Selector implementation for a record is responsible for extracting the corresponding records from an Outbreak model; a selector returns a Stream of OutputWriter.Writeable instances which the configured OutputWriter consumes.

Export writers are designed to be pluggable. The export infrastructure supports both synchronous writers (for small outputs) and asynchronous queue-based writers (for heavy per-agent exports) allowing large-scale simulations to persist outputs without blocking the main simulation loop.

Stages and intended formats

  • Export.Stage.BASELINE — baseline or pre‑simulation artefacts; typically small CSV outputs (for example infectivity profiles)
  • Export.Stage.START — produced once per execution at startup; commonly configuration snapshots and demographic exports (CSV or DuckDB)
  • Export.Stage.UPDATE — produced repeatedly during the run; commonly per‑agent or per‑time state exports and often written to DuckDB for efficiency
  • Export.Stage.FINISH — final aggregated results exported once at the end of a run

Downstream consumers

Writers in this package are consumed by analytic pipelines, notebooks and external tools that read CSV or DuckDB files for visualisation and further analysis. The exported artefacts are intentionally self‑describing so that downstream tools can join per‑agent and per‑run tables using shared ids.

Author:
Rob Challen

  • Class
    Description
    CSVWriter<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable>
    This class provides infrastructure for translating a high throughput stream of Writeable objects from multiple threads.
    DuckDBWriter<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable>
    OutputWriter implementation for writing records to a DuckDB database file.
    Export
    Annotation to mark data classes for export during simulation execution.
    Export.Selector
    Functional interface for selecting data to export from an Outbreak simulation.
    Export.Stage
    Enumeration of export stages during simulation execution.
    ExportSelector<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable>
    This is the first stage of configuring a destination for export based on the specification of the data and the mappings to get the data from the outbreak class.
    OutputWriter<X extends OutputWriter.Writeable>
    Interface for writing output data to a destination (e.g. file, database).
    OutputWriter.Writeable
    Marker interface for data records that can be written by an OutputWriter.
    QueueWriter
    A thread responsible for writing a single CSV file with a buffer.
    SimulationExporter
    This manages the various files that are being exported to so and their respective threads that the outbreak simulation doesn't have to.
